msContents.summary: Receipt for dike work performed by Kronion son of Onnnophris in the Kerkesis marsh

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
8 lines of writing by 3 different hand, all fast cursives
The formula is different than usual and the resolution of the abbreviation at the beginning of line 4 presents some problems
The text belongs to the Archive of Kronion

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 17, 1930; no. 9 (lot II) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Year 21 of Imperator Caesar Trajanus Hadrianus Augustus. Work performed on the dike works for the 20th year, from the 7th day to the 11th day of the month Hathyr in the 21st year, on the dike of the Kerkesis marsh, for the account of Tebtunis, by Kronion son of Onnophris and Thenapynchis, grandson of Apollonios. [3rd hand] I, Heron, have signed this.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. X 256 Plate 9 in P.Col. X
